What issue?
Service instance is created when reboot. That is correct.
One instance should be displayed after restarting, in fact multiple identical instances are displayed
That is your thought, not ours. Instance name could be set manually from some agents.
okay，but I think there should be only unique instance after service restart, not the one before showing on ui
You thought many things, open-source community have our own way. Committer and contributor make the call. If you want to make a decision, you need to contribute codes. Credits matter in here.

> ### What happened
> All are single deployments, The default H2 database used by OAP. there are some errors When I visit the topology tab page ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45053680/164441287-ed1cd0cd-ded6-4998-81b5-232d2fb223c0.png) I found out that it is because the monitored application has no data generated within the set time period.
> 
> "The field at path '/service_relation_client_cpm/values[0]/id' was declared as a non null type, but the code involved in retrieving data has wrongly returned a null value. The graphql specification requires that the parent field be set to null, or if that is non nullable that it bubble up null to its parent and so on. The non-nullable type is 'ID' within parent type 'KVInt' The field at path '/service_relation_client_resp_time/values[0]/id' was declared as a non null type, but the code involved in retrieving data has wrongly returned a null value. The graphql specification requires that the parent field be set to null, or if that is non nullable that it bubble up null to its parent and so on. The non-nullable type is 'ID' within parent type 'KVInt'" "The field at path '/service_relation_server_resp_time/values[0]/id' was declared as a non null type, but the code involved in retrieving data has wrongly returned a null value. The graphql specification requires that the parent field be set to null, or if that is non nullable that it bubble up null to its parent and so on. The non-nullable type is 'ID' within parent type 'KVInt' The field at path '/service_relation_server_cpm/values[0]/id' was declared as a non null type, but the code involved in retrieving data has wrongly returned a null value. The graphql specification requires that the parent field be set to null, or if that is non nullable that it bubble up null to its parent and so on. The non-nullable type is 'ID' within parent type 'KVInt'" "The field at path '/service_cpm/values[0]/id' was declared as a non null type, but the code involved in retrieving data has wrongly returned a null value. The graphql specification requires that the parent field be set to null, or if that is non nullable that it bubble up null to its parent and so on. The non-nullable type is 'ID' within parent type 'KVInt' The field at path '/service_sla/values[0]/id' was declared as a non null type, but the code involved in retrieving data has wrongly returned a null value. The graphql specification requires that the parent field be set to null, or if that is non nullable that it bubble up null to its parent and so on. The non-nullable type is 'ID' within parent type 'KVInt' The field at path '/service_resp_time/values[0]/id' was declared as a non null type, but the code involved in retrieving data has wrongly returned a null value. The graphql specification requires that the parent field be set to null, or if that is non nullable that it bubble up null to its parent and so on. The non-nullable type is 'ID' within parent type 'KVInt'"
>

[ERROR] ----------
[ERROR] 1) com.google.protobuf:protoc:exe:osx-aarch_64:3.3.0

```

I add `-Dos.detected.classifier=osx-x86_64` but still don't work.

```
./test/plugin/run.sh: line 187:  9289 Killed: 9               ${mvnw} --batch-mode -f ${home}/pom.xml -DskipTests -Dos.detected.classifier=osx-x86_64 -Dbase_image_java=${base_image_java} -Dbase_image_tomcat=${base_image_tomcat} -Dcontainer_image_version=${container_image_version} clean package

> `fabric8io/docker-maven-plugin ` 0.38.1 worked, but still error
> 
> ```
> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.xolstice.maven.plugins:protobuf-maven-plugin:0.6.1:compile (grpc-build) on project mock-collector: Unable to resolve artifact: Missing:
> [ERROR] ----------
> [ERROR] 1) com.google.protobuf:protoc:exe:osx-aarch_64:3.3.0
> ```
> 
> I add `-Dos.detected.classifier=osx-x86_64` but still don't work.
> 
> ```
> ./test/plugin/run.sh: line 187:  9289 Killed: 9               ${mvnw} --batch-mode -f ${home}/pom.xml -DskipTests -Dos.detected.classifier=osx-x86_64 -Dbase_image_java=${base_image_java} -Dbase_image_tomcat=${base_image_tomcat} -Dcontainer_image_version=${container_image_version} clean package
> ```

I've checked the issue in Skywalking-java repo. You have to update the `protoc` which may be hardcoded in many test cases now.

`protobuf` for Apple Silicon have been supported from `3.17.3`, see the comment and related PR there https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/8522#issuecomment-1033404584

Also, on M1 models, I was using `Ecplise/Temurin` distribution which can be used to build the project since it is built for `x86_64`.

@wu-sheng Please~ I open the Zipkin-receiver  in skywalking（8.9.1）, and then export the Zipkin format using the opentelemetry-collector-contrib(zipkinexporter). Can it display trace in skywalking? I did this, but there are prompts and errors. I think I may not use it correctly. Can you tell me how to configure it correctly? Thankyou~
Errors are reported as follows:
2022-05-07T09:43:05.081Z        error   exporterhelper/queued_retry_inmemory.go:109     Exporting failed. No more retries left. Dropping data.   {"kind": "exporter", "name": "zipkin", "error": "max elapsed time expired failed the request with status code 415", "dropped_items": 2}
The configuration is as follows:  
      zipkin:
        endpoint: http://skywalking-oap.skywalking:11800
        format: proto
        tls:
          insecure: true
@kezhenxu94 Could you run a single verification? Never heard of this.

@skundu1234 which SkyWalking Java agent image are you using? We don't have such image named `openjdk:8-jdk-alpine` or `adoptopenjdk:11-jre-hotspot`, please provide reproducible steps or related details.

We are using 8.9.0 Skywalking Java Agent.We are starting application along with sky-walking arguments in docker file.
Agent is downloaded in entrypoint.sh. Agent is downloaded from here: https://skywalking.apache.org/downloads/

Docker file details:
FROM openjdk:8-jdk-alpine
# copy extracted agent folder from the downloaded archive
EXPOSE 8080
ADD entrypoint.sh /app/entrypoint.sh
RUN chmod -R 777 /app/entrypoint.sh
# copy the jar file
COPY /target/spring-petclinic-2.4.5.jar /app/application.jar
WORKDIR /app
ENTRYPOINT ["entrypoint.sh", "application.jar" ]

Your docker file, your responsibility.

We have provided official docker images in dockerhub.

Docker file is fine but only base image is the problem and Skywalking agent does not work with openjdk thats also official from Docker Hub.
https://hub.docker.com/_/openjdk

Is there anything that Skywalking agent only works only certain base images.

This is duplicate of https://github.com/apache/skywalking/discussions/8975

> Docker file is fine but only base image is the problem and Skywalking agent does not work > with openjdk thats also official from Docker Hub.
> https://hub.docker.com/_/openjdk
> Is there anything that Skywalking agent only works only certain base images.

You have no idea whether base image is the only problem, for what it's worth here are my suggestions:

- Use our prebuilt Docker image instead of downloading on the fly, e.g.

  ```Dockerfile
  COPY --from=apache/skywalking-java-agent:8.9.0-alpine /skywalking/agent /path/to/your/desired/agent/location
  # ...
  ```

- `._` files are hidden so when you said `We did not see with ._apm-spring-concurrent-util-4.x-plugin-8.10.0.jar file anywhere in plugin,option plugins,activations.Not sure how _ underscore is coming.` make sure you use `ls -alh` to list all hidden files, also, these files are totally possible produced on your side please Google it first https://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/14980/why-are-dot-underscore-files-created-and-how-can-i-avoid-them

- `Agent is downloaded in entrypoint.sh`, I don't think this is a good idea because you'll need to download the agent every time you start the app, which is unnecessary and sometimes it's inconsistent from time to time.

 GRPC collector fail error log in skywalking-api.log:

ERROR 2022-05-09 11:20:28:125 SkywalkingAgent-12-GRPCChannelManager-0 GRPCChannelManager : Create channel to fail.
java.lang.NullPointerException

at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)

> @zhyyu Are you working on this?

Yes, I am working on it. I meet some classloader issue, `org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.jdbc.JDBCPluginConfig.Plugin.JDBC` is loaded by two different `AgentClassLoader` . I am finding out the reason.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22634485/167979023-782797a4-75b6-4bef-8744-5c715e77f41c.png)

I write a  `JDBCPluginDynamicConfigService` `BootService` register the watcher change the config, but business thread use another classloader to see `JDBCPluginConfig.Plugin.JDBC.TRACE_SQL_PARAMETERS`, so the watcher don't work..
I think you don't need a service,  you should have a watcher(AgentConfigChangeWatcher). Have you checked this?
I'm really interested in this task, could you pls explain what does the “observability APIs” in the third purpose above refer to?

Would you consider to enhancing https://github.com/SkyAPM/go2sky SDK first? We should be able to have. go2sky + meter APIs first, then we could have trace(optional only) + meter (required) + logs (optional) collecting for BanyanDB natively.

> AgentConfigChangeWatcher

I create a new bootservice and watcher in jdbc-commons package. If i do not create a new  service, can I reuse `ContextManagerExtendService` or other existed bootservice to register my new warcher?
Why do you make things so complex? You just need a watcher, and when the JDBC plugin is intercepting Driver initialization, you register this into the kernel, then you could have everything you need.
You don't need `bootservice`. DCS has a kernel level service already.

> Now, from UI, we can just tell the applicationCode,but don't include instances information. We should improve that.
> 
> Here is my proposal:
> 
> 1. Generate a instance id(UUID) when agent starts.
> 2. Send to collector, and get an integer id(instance-id) instead. At collector-side, provide a instance sequence for distributed application instances.(Need more discussion)
> 3. Agent send trace segments with this instance-id.
> 4. By using this id, collector can tell how many instances for each application code.
> 
> cc @sky-walking, wait for your response on this.

How can i generate UUID for instance and also remaining ?

> I believe (9048) depends on the go2sky OSPP task?
> Could we create one on go2sky repo? (Out of ASF though)

Out of curiosity, if there is dependency between multiple OSPP projects, how/when do we expect the students of each project to finish the project? Every single student should have equal time to do the work without being stressed by the fact that there is another student's work depends on  his/hers

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/9047#issuecomment-1125604323

@kezhenxu94 @Superskyyy @remGigo Let's continue the discussion here. My suggestion is either we make this task on go2sky purely or go2sky + banyandb instrumentation (advanced one).

> My suggestion is either we make this task on go2sky purely or go2sky + banyandb instrumentation (advanced one).

We could do this, adding meter feature to go2sky is definitely a big 👍 .

But why we have to couple BanyanDB and go2sky. I mean:

- We can use Prometheus protocol to provide BanyanDB metrics just like [how satellite did](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-satellite/tree/main/internal/satellite/telemetry/prometheus), OAP can already consume these metrics.
- We can add go2sky into BanyanDB if we want to add more instrumentation like traces (I believe we don't need that tho)
- We can add a independent project in go2sky to add meter feature.

SO there is no dependency between go2sky and BanyanDB

> Out of curiosity, if there is dependency between multiple OSPP projects, how/when do we expect the students of each project to finish the project? Every single student should have equal time to do the work without being stressed by the fact that there is another student's work depends on his/hers

#9048 is not an OSPP or GSoC project. It's an independent intro-level task for normal contributors.

We don't choose Prometheus for now to BanyanDB. We had a discussion before. OTEL fetcher already causes many concerns.
I agree that the tasks for students or new contributors should not have a dependency, so I suggest updating the task description.

Quoted https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/9047#issuecomment-1125620275

So, there is no concern here.

> Quoted [#9047 (comment)](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/9047#issuecomment-1125620275)
> 
> So, there is no concern here.

Ok, so to sum up, an OSPP project depends on 2 non-OSPP tasks.

#9047 depends on this issue to finish the task 👇

> - Monitor the health status of servers using observability APIs 

But this issue depends on go2sky to provide meter feature...

> #9047 depends on this issue to finish the task 👇
> 
> > * Monitor the health status of servers using observability APIs
> 
> But this issue depends on go2sky to provide meter feature...

The basic observability APIs are ready for CLI to access. They are based on Prometheus exporter go libs. The relevant feats in this thread could be based on them.
